pgrid.core.index
Class DBIndexTable

java.lang.Object
  org.xml.sax.helpers.DefaultHandler
      pgrid.core.index.IndexTable
          pgrid.core.index.DBIndexTable
All Implemented Interfaces:
ContentHandler, DTDHandler, EntityResolver, ErrorHandler
Direct Known Subclasses:
TempDBIndexTable, TransferDBIndexTable
public class DBIndexTable
extends IndexTable

Title: DBIndexTable

Description: RoutingTable subclass representing the DataBase RoutingTable

Version:
1.0
Author:
Mark Kornfilt, Surender Reddy Yerva(surenderreddy.yerva AT epfl.ch)

getIndexEntry

public IndexEntry getIndexEntry(int dataItemID,
                                String dataItem,
                                Type type)
Given the dataItemID, dataItem and the type this function returns the IndexEntry. If for given dataItemID and type ,if the indexEntry does not belong to the local index table then this function returns null.

Parameters:
dataItemID -
dataItem -
type -
Returns:

public String getIndexEntryAsXML(int dataItemID,
                                 String dataItem,
                                 Type type)

type -

This method saves the signature and deletes duplicate GUID type data items

saveSignatureCache

public void saveSignatureCache(Hashtable cache)
Save signature cache to DB

Parameters:
cache - a hash table contining host as key and Signature as values

select

public void select(DBIndexTable it,
                   String[] keys,
                   String[] except,
                   boolean delete)
Copy part of the current index table into it.it will contain entries selected with keys and except. if delete is true, this method will split the current index table based on keys and except. If delete is false, this method will only copy entries from this index table to it.

Parameters:
it - an empty index table (no check is done for performance reasons)
keys - keys to copy
except - keys to avoid
delete - true if copied entries should be removed from this index table.

sequentialAdd1

public void sequentialAdd1(IndexEntry entry)
Insert a new index entry in DB. Insertion is not done immediately but only when the internal buffer is reached. Insert can be forced with flushInsert.

Parameters:
entry - index entry to be added.

setIndexTable

public void setIndexTable(String path)
Sets the data table to contain only elements with the given path.

Parameters:
path - the path of the local index table.
